intro: Canthium dewildemanianum, commonly known as the dewildemanian spurges, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Canthium dewildemanianum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
